archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Habanero Jerk Wings with Coconut Rice and Mango Salsa
description: Grilled habanero-jerk chicken wings with creamy coconut rice and a quick mango-lime salsa. Blazing heat, simple steps, and fast family cooking.
prep_steps: Pat dry 1.5 kg chicken wings with paper towels.
Finely chop 2 habanero peppers (wear gloves) and 3 garlic cloves.
Zest and juice 2 limes; keep zest and juice separate.
Peel and dice 1 large mango; finely chop a small handful of coriander.
Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until mostly clear.
Measure 1 can coconut milk (about 400 ml) and 1.5 cups vegetable stock.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high (or heat a large grill pan on the stovetop). Oil grates lightly.
cook_steps: Make jerk marinade: In a bowl, mix chopped habanero, garlic, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1 tsp allspice, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp olive oil, and half the lime juice.
Toss wings in the marinade until coated. Let sit 5–10 minutes while rice starts.

Start rice: In a pot, combine rinsed jasmine rice, coconut milk, vegetable stock, a pinch of salt, and lime zest. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Rest off heat, covered, 5 minutes; fluff before serving.
Grill wings: Place wings on the hot grill. Cook 12–15 minutes, turning every 3–4 minutes, until nicely charred and cooked through (juices run clear).
Make quick mango salsa: In a bowl, combine diced mango, 1/2 cup salsa, remaining lime juice, and chopped coriander. Stir and set aside.
Finish wings: Brush lightly with a little hot sauce for extra heat (optional).
Serve: Plate coconut rice, top with grilled wings, and spoon mango salsa on the side.

ingredients.preparation: in marinade; plus for grill grates

final_ingredients.preparation: in marinade; plus for grill grates
